intro: Heteropterys bellonis, commonly known as the red-stemmed beauty, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
